electricFormA_tria3.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /******************************************************************************
00002 * File      : electricFormA_tria3.c                                           *
00003 * Author    : Carlos Rosales Fernandez (carlos@ihpc.a-star.edu.sg)            *
00004 * Date      : 01-09-2006                                                      *
00005 * Revision  : 1.0                                                             *
00006 *******************************************************************************
00007 * DESCRIPTION                                                                 *
00008 * Forms the coefficient matrix mA by assembling submatrices of the element,   *
00009 * SubA, for the IBEM AC electrostatic case. Uses symmetry to reduce storage.  *
00010 * Works for linear interpolation in triangular elements (3-noded triangles).  *
00011 ******************************************************************************/
00012 
00013 /******************************************************************************
00014 * COPYRIGHT & LICENSE INFORMATION                                             *
00015 *                                                                             *
00016 * Copyright 2006 Carlos Rosales Fernandez and The Institute of High           *
00017 * Performance Computing (A*STAR)                                              *
00018 *                                                                             *
00019 * This file is part of depSolver.                                             *
00020 *                                                                             *
00021 * depSolver is free software; you can redistribute it and/or modify           *
00022 * it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by        *
00023 * the Free Software Foundation; either version 2 of the License, or           *
00024 * (at your option) any later version.                                         *
00025 *                                                                             *
00026 * depSolver is distributed in the hope that it will be useful,                *
00027 * but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of              *
00028 * MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.  See the               *
00029 * GNU General Public License for more details.                                *
00030 *                                                                             *
00031 * You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License           *
00032 * along with depSolver; if not, write to the Free Software                    *
00033 * Foundation, Inc., 51 Franklin St, Fifth Floor, Boston, MA  02110-1301  USA  *
00034 ******************************************************************************/
00035 
00036 #include "constants.h"
00037 #include "electricFormA_tria3.h"
00038 
00039 int electricFormA_tria3(double **mNodes, unsigned int **mElems, 
00040                         unsigned int *vBCType, unsigned int **vInterfaces, 
00041                         double **vMatParam, double *vProbParam, double **mA, 
00042                         double **mBC, double *vB)
00043 {
00044     const unsigned int FLAG = 0, NODES_IN_ELEM = 3;
00045     unsigned int i, interfaceID, j, k, mat1, mat2, currentNode, SinNode;  
00046     double C, D, EpsDif, EpsTot, SigDif, SigTot, W;
00047     double Xeval[3], SubA[3], normal[3];
00048     double X[3][3];
00049     double *A, *B;
00050 
00051     /* Auxiliar quantities for eqs at conductors */
00052     C = 1.0/(pi4*eps0);
00053 
00054     /* Auxiliar quantities for eqs at dielectric interfaces */
00055     if(nInterfaces){
00056         W = vProbParam[0]*pi2*eps0;
00057         A = doubleVector(nInterfaces,0);
00058         B = doubleVector(nInterfaces,0);
00059  
00060         for(i = 0; i < nInterfaces; i++){
00061             mat1 = vInterfaces[i][0] - 1;
00062             mat2 = vInterfaces[i][1] - 1;
00063             SigTot = vMatParam[mat1][0] + vMatParam[mat2][0];
00064             SigDif = vMatParam[mat1][0] - vMatParam[mat2][0];
00065             EpsTot = W*(vMatParam[mat1][1] + vMatParam[mat2][1]);
00066             EpsDif = W*(vMatParam[mat1][1] - vMatParam[mat2][1]);
00067             D = C/(SigTot*SigTot + EpsTot*EpsTot);
00068             A[i] = D*(SigTot*SigDif + EpsTot*EpsDif);
00069             B[i] = D*(SigDif*EpsTot - SigTot*EpsDif);
00070         }
00071     }
00072 
00073     /* Find contributions to each node and assemble coefficient matrix */
00074     for(i = 0; i < nNodes; i++){
00075         Xeval[0] = mNodes[i][0];
00076         Xeval[1] = mNodes[i][1];
00077         Xeval[2] = mNodes[i][2];
00078 
00079         /* Operations necessary only for dielectric interfaces */
00080         if(vBCType[i] == 0 || vBCType[i] == 6){
00081             
00082             /* Get interface and normal at evaluation point */
00083             interfaceID = (unsigned int)mBC[i][1]-1;
00084             getNormal_tria3(i+1,mNodes,mElems,normal);
00085 
00086             /* Add diagonal terms due to jump across interface */
00087             mA[i][i] -= 0.5/eps0;
00088         }
00089 
00090         /* Loop through elements doing integrals for each pair of nodes */
00091         for(j = 0; j < nElems; j++){
00092                 
00093             /* Test for singular case */
00094             SinNode = 0;
00095             for(k = 0; k < NODES_IN_ELEM; k++){
00096                 currentNode = mElems[j][k] - 1;
00097                 X[k][0] = mNodes[currentNode][0];
00098                 X[k][1] = mNodes[currentNode][1];
00099                 X[k][2] = mNodes[currentNode][2];
00100                 if(currentNode == i) SinNode = k + 1;
00101             }
00102 
00103             /* Potential given */
00104             if(vBCType[i] == 1){
00105                 if(!SinNode) intG_tria3(X,Xeval,SubA);
00106                 else intSingularG_tria3(SinNode,X,Xeval,SubA);
00107             
00108                 /* Assign contributions to the right places in the matrix */
00109                 for(k = 0; k < NODES_IN_ELEM; k++)
00110                     mA[i][mElems[j][k] - 1] += C*SubA[k];
00111             }
00112         
00113             /* Dielectric interface */
00114             else{
00115                 if(!SinNode) intH_tria3(FLAG,X,Xeval,SubA,normal);
00116                 else intSingularH_tria3(FLAG,SinNode,X,Xeval,SubA,normal);
00117             
00118                 /* Assign contributions to the right places in the matrix */
00119                 for(k = 0; k < NODES_IN_ELEM; k++){
00120                     currentNode = mElems[j][k] - 1;
00121                     mA[i][currentNode] += A[interfaceID]*SubA[k];
00122                     mA[i][currentNode + nNodes] += B[interfaceID]*SubA[k];
00123                 }
00124             }
00125         }
00126 
00127         /* Assemble right hand side vector */
00128         vB[i] = mBC[i][0];
00129         vB[i + nNodes] = mBC[i + nNodes][0];
00130     }
00131 
00132     /* Free only when necessary */
00133     if(nInterfaces){
00134         free(A);
00135         free(B);
00136     }
00137 
00138     return 0;
00139 }
